repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Define a CMake target for every subdirectory of test/functional that
contains functional tests, and a functionaltest_parallel target that
depends on all those targets, allowing multiple test runners to run in
parallel.

On CI, use at most 2 parallel test runners, as using more may increase
system load and make tests unstable.

comment_data.body:
~~Eventually, I wonder if we should enforce that tests create files only in tmpdir, instead of the repo workspace.~~

Better approach: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37964


comment_data.body:
don't need a dot prefix imo

```suggestion
    set(summary_file "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/${group_target}.summary")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,20 +29,48 @@ configure_file(
   ${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}/test/cmakeconfig/paths.lua.in
   ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/test/cmakeconfig/paths.lua)
 
-add_custom_target(functionaltest
+add_custom_target(benchmark
   COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND}
-    -D TEST_TYPE=functional
+    -D TEST_TYPE=benchmark
     ${TEST_OPTIONS}
     -P ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/cmake/RunTests.cmake
-  DEPENDS printenv-test printargs-test shell-test pwsh-test streams-test tty-test
+  DEPENDS tty-test
   USES_TERMINAL)
-add_dependencies(functionaltest lua_dev_deps nvim)
+add_dependencies(benchmark lua_dev_deps nvim)
 
-add_custom_target(benchmark
+add_custom_target(functionaltest
   COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND}
-    -D TEST_TYPE=benchmark
+    -D TEST_TYPE=functional
     ${TEST_OPTIONS}
     -P ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/cmake/RunTests.cmake
-  DEPENDS tty-test
+  DEPENDS printenv-test printargs-test shell-test pwsh-test streams-test tty-test
   USES_TERMINAL)
-add_dependencies(benchmark lua_dev_deps nvim)
+add_dependencies(functionaltest lua_dev_deps nvim)
+
+# Create multiple targets for groups of functional tests to enable parallel testing.
+set(group_targets "")
+set(summary_files "")
+file(GLOB_RECURSE test_files RELATIVE "${TEST_DIR}/functional" "${TEST_DIR}/functional/*_spec*")
+foreach(test_file ${test_files})
+  # Get test group: "test/functional/foo/bar_spec.lua" => "foo"
+  string(REGEX REPLACE "/.*" "" test_group ${test_file})
+  set(group_target "functionaltest_${test_group}")
+  string(REGEX REPLACE "[^A-Za-z0-9_]" "_" group_target ${group_target})
+  list(FIND group_targets ${group_target} group_idx)
+  if(${group_idx} EQUAL -1)
+    # Create new target for test group.
+    set(summary_file "${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/.${group_target}.summary")

comment_data.body:
we should drop this dot
```suggestion
  set(ENV{NVIM_LOG_FILE} ${BUILD_DIR}/nvimlog)
```
This dot appears in many other places (and dev_test.txt). Perhaps it can be removed in a later PR.

comment_regular_data.body:
Nice! I guess one tricky part will be collecting the output from each parallel target. Currently it looks like only one test group is printing results.

WDYT about this approach:

1\. print an initial summary of test groups that will be run:

```
Test groups:
foo
bar
baz
```

2\. print a dot "." every X seconds so that CI knows the job is alive.

```
..........
```

3\. dump all the results when all groups are finished.

---

Also, for now, perhaps we only need to parallelize tsan + asan? OTOH, aligning on one approach is simpler, so maybe not.

> Also, for now, perhaps we only need to parallelize tsan + asan?

The Windows job sometimes times out as well.

Strange timeout on Windows:
```
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636053Z -------- 19 tests from test/functional/ui/winbar_spec.lua (2210.00 ms total)
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636057Z 
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636145Z -------- Global test environment teardown.
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636263Z ======== 1895 tests from 38 test files ran. (253610.00 ms total)
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636335Z PASSED   1883 tests.
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636414Z SKIPPED  12 tests, listed below:
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636671Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/bufhl_spec.lua @ 450: Buffer highlighting prioritizes latest added highlight
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6636907Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/decorations_spec.lua @ 8050: decorations: window scoped sign_text
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6637585Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua @ 588: float window with only one tabpage, deleting the last non-floating window's buffer closes other windows with that buffer when there are other buffers if called from floating window with another buffer
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6638243Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua @ 621: float window with only one tabpage, deleting the last non-floating window's buffer creates an empty buffer when there is only one listed buffer if called from floating window with an unlisted buffer
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6638994Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua @ 790: float window with multiple tabpages and multiple listed buffers, deleting the last non-floating window's buffer closes the tabpage when all floating windows are closeable if called from floating window with another buffer
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6639360Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua @ 4856: float window with ext_multigrid and actual mouse grid supports second UI without multigrid
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6639697Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/float_spec.lua @ 4856: float window with ext_multigrid and mouse grid 0 supports second UI without multigrid
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6639953Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/hlstate_spec.lua @ 210: ext_hlstate detailed highlights work with :terminal
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6640031Z test\testutil.lua:852: FIXME
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6640299Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/messages_spec.lua @ 2423: ui/msg_puts_printf output multibyte characters correctly
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6640445Z test\testutil.lua:852: Nvim not built with ENABLE_TRANSLATIONS
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6640723Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/output_spec.lua @ 44: shell command :! displays output without LF/EOF. #4646 #4569 #3772
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6640797Z test\testutil.lua:852: FIXME
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641090Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/output_spec.lua @ 66: shell command :! throttles shell-command output greater than ~10KB
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641162Z test\testutil.lua:852: FIXME
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641458Z SKIPPED  test/functional/ui/output_spec.lua @ 104: shell command :! handles control codes
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641540Z test\testutil.lua:852: missing printf
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641551Z 
2026-02-17T13:03:11.6641618Z  12 SKIPPED TESTS
2026-02-17T13:11:29.5572434Z ##[error]The action 'functionaltest' has timed out after 20 minutes
```
The vimscript/ tests are never executed?

Or perhaps it's not caused by the parallel tests, but some other factor...

I got the summary collection working.

> print a dot "." every X seconds so that CI knows the job is alive.

I don't know how to do this.

> > print a dot "." every X seconds so that CI knows the job is alive.
> 
> I don't know how to do this.

Maybe we don't need to solve this. I can't find any reference about whether github CI has "stalled/hang detection". 

Just for reference, it seems that ninja doesn't have a way to print a heartbeat: https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja/issues/111

> on master the test runner reports `PASSED 8931 tests` which is probably wrong (it counts things other than `it()` cases?).

If a test file doesn't require testnvim.lua, its `it()` cases don't use test IDs.

title: test: support running functionaltests in parallel by directory
